topics.body: Well apparently the crimea vote to join russia was rigged.  No wonder why russia is trying to rush crimea joining so fast; the sooner they do it the more likely they'll get away with it.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5328ff906368725fe71c0100#post_5328ff906368725fe71c0100
Russia engaging in underhanded politics? I am shocked to my very core.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5328ff906368725fe71c0100#post_5328ff906368725fe71c0100
really? I don't even think they would have had to rig it as I believe Crimea is almost purely ethnically Russian.
Then again, when you show up with tanks...

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5329002563687264d1bf0100#post_5329002563687264d1bf0100

Also 123% of voters in sevastopol voted.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532900a663687227d7180000#post_532900a663687227d7180000

It had a "Stay with Ukraine" option. But the biggest element is that more people voted pro-Russia than there are actual Russians in Crimea. The "Yes" votes already more-or-less imply that all the Tatars - or most - voted to join the Federation, and the leaders of the Tatar communities called out to their people to boycott the election, which they did.

And the Ukranians would have more-than-likely voted "no", which I believe some did.

"In all, Vice's Simon Ostrovsky even said the vote smelled very Soviet.":http://youtu.be/AqHeZUS9_EY
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body:
Well looks like there's going to be a war now.  Ukraine after russia opened fired and killed a ukrainian soldier has now authorized soldiers to shoot back.

Given that russia doesn't give a fuck and opened fire first I give it less than a week before this becomes a war.

topics.body:
Hmmmm. You know. Looking into it, I never noticed how often Celestia gets the short stick in....about anything.

One most beaten by fanon villains: Celestia
One most often turned evil jackass for no reason with no redeeming qualities:...Twilight, Celestia in second
One that gets worf effect: Celestia
One blamed most for something big and bad happening: Celestia.
Overshadowed in her own microseries.
Never gonna get an episode.

Poor Sunbutt.

"@NotYourAverageLurker":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/532977c56368727914250000#post_532977c56368727914250000

topics.body:
"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5329c7be6368720b669c0000#post_5329c7be6368720b669c0000
The deck was stacked against her from the start I'm afraid. She's an authority figure, associated with light, and not a main character no matter how much you want to stretch the definition.

Hell, even in canon she's little more than a plot device.
